PRINCIPAL PROCEDURE : Total abdominal hysterectomy . HISTORY OF PRESENT ILLNESS : This is a 42-year-old , gravida 0 with symptomatic uterine fibroids . The patient has had menorrhagia for five to six months , as well as pelvic pain . Her hematocrit was 32.2 and she was placed on iron . An ultrasound on 10/95 showed multiple fibroids , retroverted uterus . The largest fibroid was 4.6 cm on the anterior wall . The ovaries were normal . PAST MEDICAL HISTORY : Diabetes mellitus since May 1996 . PAST SURGICAL HISTORY : None . ADMISSION MEDICATIONS : Iron 325 mg p.o. t.i.d. , Glucophage b.i.d. , and Micronase 5 mg p.o. q.day . ALLERGIES : No known drug allergies . PHYSICAL EXAMINATION : The patient was in no apparent distress . Her blood pressure was 118/80 , afebrile , and her other vital signs were stable . Her skin was normal . She had no nodes felt . Breasts had no masses and were nontender . Lungs were clear to auscultation bilaterally . Heart had a regular rate and rhythm with no murmur . Her abdomen was soft and nontender . Pelvic examination revealed her external genitalia was normal . Her cervix was normal . Her uterus was retroverted and bulky . There were no masses in the adnexa . HOSPITAL COURSE : The patient was admitted and underwent a total abdominal hysterectomy without complications . There was 75 cc of blood loss . The patient was given cefotetan intraoperatively and given two doses postoperatively . Her postoperative course was uncomplicated . The patient had good return of bowel function and was discharged on postoperative day four , feeling well . She was tolerating a regular diet and had a postoperative hematocrit of 30.4. She was continued on her glyburide and her sugars were well controlled in the 120s. FOLLOW-UP : She is to follow up with Dr. Signs in three to four weeks . DISCHARGE MEDICATIONS : Ferro-Sequels one tablet p.o. b.i.d. , Percocet one to two tabs p.o. q.3-4h. p.r.n. pain , ibuprofen 600 mg p.o. q.6h. p.r.n. pain , glyburide 5 mg p.o. q.day , and Glucophage b.i.d.
